10. Real-Time voice trades -> trade ticket population
13. User launches multiple apps from a single container

api/api-intro.title: API Overview
api/api-intro.description: FDC3 API standards support the following goals:

api/Context.title: Context
api/Context.description: The base object that all contexts should extend.

api/DesktopAgent.title: DesktopAgent
api/DesktopAgent.description: A Desktop Agent is a desktop component (or aggregate of components) that serves as a launcher and message router (broker) for applications in its domain.

api/ref/Channel.title: Channel
api/ref/Channel.description: Represents a context channel that applications can join to share context data.

api/ref/DesktopAgent.title: DesktopAgent
api/ref/DesktopAgent.description: An FDC3 Desktop Agent is a desktop component (or aggregate of components) that serves as an orchestrator for applications in its domain.

api/ref/Errors.title: Errors
api/ref/Errors.description: FDC3 API operations may sometimes result in an error, which must be returned to the caller. Errors should be returned by rejecting the promise returned by the API with a JavaScript Error object (or equivalent for the language of the implementation). The Error Object's message should be chosen from the appropriate Error enumeration below.

api/ref/Globals.title: Globals
api/ref/Globals.description: Since FDC3 is typically available to the whole web application, desktop agents are expected to make the DesktopAgent interface available at a global level.

api/ref/Metadata.title: Metadata
api/ref/Metadata.description: FDC3 API operations return various types of metadata.

api/ref/PrivateChannel.title: PrivateChannel
api/ref/PrivateChannel.description: Object representing a private context channel, which is intended to support secure communication between applications, and extends the Channel interface with event handlers which provide information on the connection state of both parties, ensuring that desktop agents do not need to queue or retain messages that are broadcast before a context listener is added and that applications are able to stop broadcasting messages when the other party has disconnected.

api/ref/Types.title: Types
api/ref/Types.description: FDC3 API operations make use of several type declarations.

api/spec.title: API Overview (next)
api/spec.description: The role of FDC3 API is to establish a baseline interface for interoperability between applications. Because FDC3 is largely an agreement between existing platforms and applications, standards should be optimized for ease of adoption rather than functional completeness. Functionality absent from a FDC3 specification is in no way a commentary on its importance.

app-directory/overview.title: App Directory Overview (next)
app-directory/overview.description: An application directory (appD) is a structured repository of information about apps that can be used in an FDC3-enabled desktop. In other words, it’s a convenient way of storing and managing metadata about apps in your ecosystem.

app-directory/spec.title: App Directory API (next)
app-directory/spec.description: View the full specification in OpenAPI v3.0 format (generated with ReDoc).

appd-intro.title: App Directory Overview
appd-intro.description: The FDC3 App Directory provides trusted identity for financial desktop apps. This identity can be used to prevent spoofing and man-in-the-middle attacks when apps communicate with one another and exchange data. The App Directory also enables service discovery. Apps are registered with a declaration of the intents and context data that can be used when interoperating.

appd-use.title: App Directory Use
appd-use.description: An application directory (AppD) provides information about an application's

context-intro.title: Context Data Overview
context-intro.description: Extending APIs from one application to another is powerful. However, it requires bi-lateral agreements where implementors build to proprietary APIs. A standard language for interaction between applications allows us to create workflows on the fly, so that applications can discover and link to one another without any prior knowledge.

context/ref/Chart.title: Chart
context/ref/Chart.description: A context type representing details of a Chart, which may be used to request plotting of a particular chart or to otherwise share details of its composition, such as:

context/ref/ChatInitSettings.title: ChatInitSettings
context/ref/ChatInitSettings.description: A collection of settings to start a new chat conversation

context/ref/Contact.title: Contact
context/ref/Contact.description: A person contact that can be engaged with through email, calling, messaging, CMS, etc.

context/ref/ContactList.title: ContactList
context/ref/ContactList.description: A collection of contacts, e.g. for chatting to or calling multiple contacts.

context/ref/Context.title: Context
context/ref/Context.description: The fdc3.context type defines the basic contract or "shape" for all data exchanged by FDC3 operations. As such, it is not

context/ref/Currency.title: Currency
context/ref/Currency.description: A context representing an individual Currency.

context/ref/Email.title: Email
context/ref/Email.description: A collection of information to be used to initiate an email with a Contact or ContactList

context/ref/Instrument.title: Instrument
context/ref/Instrument.description: A financial instrument from any asset class.

context/ref/InstrumentList.title: InstrumentList
context/ref/InstrumentList.description: A collection of instruments. Use this type for use cases that require not just a single instrument, but multiple (e.g. to populate a watchlist).

context/ref/Nothing.title: Nothing
context/ref/Nothing.description: A type that explicitly represents a lack of context.

context/ref/Organization.title: Organization
context/ref/Organization.description: An entity that can be used when referencing private companies and other organizations where a specific instrument is not available or desired e.g. CRM and News workflows.

context/ref/Portfolio.title: Portfolio
context/ref/Portfolio.description: A financial portfolio made up of multiple positions (holdings) in several instruments. Contrast this

context/ref/Position.title: Position
context/ref/Position.description: A financial position made up of an instrument and a holding in that instrument. This type is a good

context/ref/TimeRange.title: TimeRange
context/ref/TimeRange.description: A context representing a period of time. Any user interfaces that represent or visualise events or activity over time can be filtered or focused on a particular time period, e.g.:

context/ref/Valuation.title: Valuation
context/ref/Valuation.description: A context type representing the price and value of a holding.

context/spec.title: Context Data (next)
context/spec.description: To interoperate, apps need to exchange commonly recognized context structures that can indicate topic with any number of identifiers or mappings to different systems. FDC3 Context Data defines a standard for passing common identifiers and data between apps to create a seamless workflow. FDC3 Context Data is not a symbology solution and is not specifically focused on modeling financial objects. The focus is on providing a standard payload structure that can be used to establish a lowest common denominator for interoperability.

fdc3-compliance.title: FDC3 Specification Compliance
fdc3-compliance.description: FDC3 standards follow the IETF best practices for keywords to Indicate Requirement levels: RFC 2119.  Documentation should be updated as needed to reflect this.

fdc3-glossary.title: Glossary of Terms
fdc3-glossary.description: For the purposes of this Standard, the following definitions apply. Other terms are defined when first used, at which place they appear in bold and italic type. Terms explicitly defined in this Standard are not to be presumed to refer implicitly to similar terms defined elsewhere. Terms not defined are assumed to be well-known in the financial services or software industries.

guides/submit-new-intent.title: How to Submit a New Intent PR

intents-intro.title: Intents Overview
intents-intro.description: Extending APIs from one application to another is powerful. However, it requires bi-lateral agreements where implementors build to proprietary APIs. A standard language for interaction between applications allows us to create workflows on the fly, so that applications can discover and link to another without any prior knowledge.

intents/ref/StartCall.title: StartCall
intents/ref/StartCall.description: Initiate a call with a contact or list of contacts.

intents/ref/StartChat.title: StartChat
intents/ref/StartChat.description: Initiate a chat with a contact, a list of contacts or detailed initialization settings.

intents/ref/StartEmail.title: StartEmail
intents/ref/StartEmail.description: Initiate an email with a contact or list of contacts provided as part of an Email context.

intents/ref/ViewAnalysis.title: ViewAnalysis
intents/ref/ViewAnalysis.description: Display analysis on the provided context.

intents/ref/ViewChart.title: ViewChart
intents/ref/ViewChart.description: Display a chart for the provided context.

intents/ref/ViewContact.title: ViewContact
intents/ref/ViewContact.description: Note: ViewContact has been deprecated in FDC3 2.0 in favour of the more general ViewProfile intent.

intents/ref/ViewHoldings.title: ViewHoldings
intents/ref/ViewHoldings.description: Display any holdings for the provided instrument, list of instruments, or organization.

intents/ref/ViewInstrument.title: ViewInstrument
intents/ref/ViewInstrument.description: Display details for the provided instrument.

intents/ref/ViewInteractions.title: ViewInteractions
intents/ref/ViewInteractions.description: Display interactions (calls, meetings, etc.) related to an individual, an instrument or organization provided as context.

intents/ref/ViewNews.title: ViewNews
intents/ref/ViewNews.description: Display news stories for the provided context.

intents/ref/ViewOrders.title: ViewOrders
intents/ref/ViewOrders.description: Display any orders related to the provided contact, instrument, or organization.

intents/ref/ViewProfile.title: ViewProfile
intents/ref/ViewProfile.description: Display basic profile information for the individual or organization provided as context.

intents/ref/ViewResearch.title: ViewResearch
intents/ref/ViewResearch.description: Show research related to an instrument, an individual or organization provided as context.

intents/spec.title: Intents Overview (next)
intents/spec.description: FDC3 Intents define a standard set of verbs that, in conjunction with context data acting as nouns, can be used to put together common cross-application workflows on the financial desktop.

references.title: References & Bibliography
references.description: The following normative documents contain provisions, which, through reference in this text, constitute provisions of this Standard. For dated references, subsequent amendments to, or revisions of, any of these publications do not apply. However, parties to agreements based on this Standard are encouraged to investigate the possibility of applying the most recent editions of the normative documents indicated below. For undated references, the latest edition of the normative document referred to applies:

supported-platforms.title: Supported Platforms
supported-platforms.description: FDC3 is platform- and programming language-independent. An FDC3-capable platform requires a Desktop Agent that supports the FDC3 standard, and that agent is responsible for coordinating application interactions.

trademarks.title: Trademarks
trademarks.description: The trademarks, logos, and service marks not owned on behalf of FDC3 and FINOS and that are displayed on the Site are the registered and unregistered marks of their respective owners. No rights are granted by the FDC3 or FINOS to use such marks, whether by implication, estoppel, or otherwise.
